text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Monday:
- Swiss Interior Minister Ruth Dreifuss said in an interview published on Sunday that she was against wage cuts for federal railway staff.
- Swiss Defence Minister Adolf Ogi met his American colleague William Perry on Saturday to discuss the Bosnian situation.

- Swiss Telecom plans to cut rates in November for both international and domestic call. The company plans to introduce off-peak rates for international calls, which will be 25 percent lower than normal calls.
- Delegates of the Swiss Radical Democrats and the Swiss People's Party voted in favour of a more liberalized labour law on Saturday.
